intro: Edwardsia chrysophylla var. lanaiensis, commonly known as the Lanai dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its yellow, dandelion-like flowers and basal rosette of fleshy, waxy leaves. The plant thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. This variety is notable for its unique morphology and ecological significance in Hawaiian ecosystems.
